alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New Mexico, including the following county, Lincoln with areas between Capitan and Encinoso being impacted. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ruidoso, Lincoln, Capitan, Encinoso, Smokey Bear Historical Park, Fort Stanton and Lincoln State Monument. - This includes the following highways... Highway 380 between Mile Markers 81 and 98. This includes the following low water crossings... Salazar Canyon Road at Rio Bonito, Capitan Gap Road at Salado Creek, Dean Drive at North Fork Salado Creek, Sandia and Dean Drive at North Fork Salado Creek, Sandia Drive at North Fork Salado Creek and Salazar Canyon Road at Rio Bonito. This includes the following recreation areas... Smokey Bear Historical Park and Lincoln State Monument. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: The heavy rainfall and slow movement of these storms will result in flooding of road intersections, low lying areas and normally dry arroyos.
